image.altText: Anthony Albanese sings with a Matilda scarf around his neck

props.synopsis: The PM suggests Australians should buy local goods instead of American ones ahead of a federal budget expected to have an "Australian-made" theme.

title.children: Albanese invokes 'Team Australia' in pitch to buy local after Trump tariffs

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: The government is banking on voters appreciating that this time around with Trump is different.

title.children: Gone is Albanese's softly-softly approach towards Trump

image.altText: Dozens of people walk through Brisbane's Queen Street Mall, most are out of focus and the crowd stretches into the distance.

props.synopsis: As the geopolitical landscape quickly shifts, a new report says Australia faces major economic challenges.

title.children: Should Australia rethink its high population growth model?

image.altText: Trump rests his fingertips together at his desk in the Oval Office

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump's decision to impose tariffs on all steel and aluminium imports to 25 per cent has been placed on some of the country's closest allies. This is how they have responded.

title.children: Here's how US allies have responded to President Donald Trump's tariffs

image.altText: A man with grey hair and wearing a suit standing outside a court in busy Sydney CBD.

props.synopsis: A jury has found former Australian cricketer Stuart MacGill guilty of taking part in the supply of cocaine in Sydney.

title.children: Former cricketer Stuart MacGill found guilty over cocaine deal

image.altText: Trump and Musk look out the open driver's side door of a red Tesla

props.synopsis: Donald Trump turned the White House lawn into a Tesla showroom on Tuesday as he attempted to buoy his ally's brand. But can he even drive the car he bought?

title.children: Why Trump can’t drive the Tesla he just bought

image.altText: Aboriginal child wearing brightly coloured shirt reading 'Reading opens doors'.

props.synopsis: Those in the Indigenous community have become used to hearing dire statistics, all for them to be ignored or not acted upon, time and time again.

title.children: Another shameful Closing the Gap report is destined to gather dust on the shelf

image.altText: An iPhone turned on its side with a white Australian Super logo displayed on the screen.

props.synopsis: An Australian Super member has hit out at the fund for delays in processing an insurance claim for disability related payments. His case comes as corporate watchdog ASIC issues a warning to super funds that delay death and disability payments to their members.

title.children: 'Impacted my life': Australian Super member says delays in claim almost left him homeless

image.altText: A US influencer holding a joey wombat that is in distress with its mouth open

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says it's unlikely the influencer would return to Australia in the future, due to the "level of scrutiny" her visa application would receive.

title.children: Influencer who snatched baby wombat from its mother has visa reviewed

image.altText: The two divers in the water after being spotted by crew members on board Rottnest Fast Ferries.

props.synopsis: A man who was picked up by a Perth ferry after his dive boat left him behind says failing to account for every diver before leaving a site is unacceptable.

title.children: Scuba diver left behind in ocean welcomes safety investigation

image.altText: A head and shoulders profile shot of Terence John Fisher posing for a photo with a bushy beard.

props.synopsis: Evolving DNA technology helps WA Police identify Terence John Fisher as the man they suspect killed Perth woman Kerryn Tate 45 years ago, with his name also linked to two other unsolved murders.

title.children: Police name suspect in 1979 cold case murder after DNA breakthrough

image.altText: A prefab module for an apartment building.

props.synopsis: Prefab housing has been touted as the answer to Australia's housing supply for years, but it's an industry plagued with high costs, low scale and a desperate need for investment if it's ever going to be a solution.

title.children: Sweden builds houses in days, Australia tried to do that 50 years ago

image.altText: People carry garbage bags picking up rubbish on a beach.

props.synopsis: Queensland's bay islands act as a natural buffer protecting the mainland from severe storm surges, and helped save Brisbane from the full force of Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: The islands that saved millions from Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: A young man with dark hair and a beard stands outside a house in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The former retail worker in Melbourne says the tech giant told him to stop wearing a pro-Palestinian necklace and bracelet because the jewellery made other employees and customers feel "unsafe" and "unwelcome".

title.children: Worker accuses Apple of discrimination over jewellery supporting Gaza

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has reversed early gains, despite a recovery in US stocks driven by a rally in the beaten-down tech sector. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX down despite tech-led Wall St share rebound

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 44,000 insurance claims lodged following ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred
Former Woolworths CEO lands new role
Consumer spending subdued, RBA to cut rates in May: CBA

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A police officer, an ATO officer and a Border Force agent look out over a large tobacco crop.

props.synopsis: Police say the destruction of a 5.2ha tobacco crop in Victoria will significantly impact the booming black market.

title.children: $35m worth of illegal tobacco up in smoke after huge crop seized

image.altText: CCTV of a man wearing a face mask.

props.synopsis: A 91-year-old Victorian woman thought she was handing her bank card over for protection from fraudulent charges, but it was a scam.

title.children: Police launch search after $130,000 stolen from elderly woman

image.altText: A green tent in a park. An empty black camping chair next to it.

props.synopsis: The decision was made after the City of Moreton Bay made homeless camping a crime on public land, with the Brisbane mayor saying the city can no longer take a "compassionate and flexible approach".

title.children: Brisbane mayor vows to evict homeless campers within 24 hours

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue spacesuits pose for a photo, smiling.

props.synopsis: The mission for the return of two astronauts stranded on the International Space Station was scrubbed over a technical issue with the rocket's launch pad.

title.children: SpaceX delays mission to replace NASA's stranded astronauts

image.altText: A South Korean soldier gestures near a bomb accident site

props.synopsis: The two pilots were charged with criminal negligence over the accidental bombing, which injured at least 29 people.

title.children: South Korea charges air force pilots over accidental bombing of village

image.altText: Manele in chair

props.synopsis: In an exclusive interview, and the first time a Solomon Islands leader has sat down with the ABC in almost six years, new prime minister Jeremiah Manele says 'differences' remain over a new policing agreement with Australia.

title.children: Solomon Islands leader takes aim at Trump over 'regrettable' climate position

image.altText: Skincare hero image

props.synopsis: If your child has started to show an interest in skincare, there are a few things you need to consider before they start using new products.

title.children: Experts on the risks of 'cheap' skincare for teens and tweens

image.altText: A large tree across a road and powerlines.

props.synopsis: More than 33,000 properties remain without power across south-east Queensland, with about half of the outages on the Gold Coast

title.children: Energex crews 'literally with machetes' as recovery turns to challenging areas

image.altText: A flat lay of a calculator, an electricity bill and a mobile phone displaying an ABC article about electricity prices.

props.synopsis: Power prices are set to rise yet again, with the energy market regulator lifting the benchmarks for how much retailers can charge for electricity.

title.children: Power prices to rise nearly 9 per cent for some from mid-year

image.altText: Brayden Maynard and Collingwood players walk off the ground

props.synopsis: Brayden Maynard is expected to line up for Collingwood in round one despite being involved in a car crash days out from the match against Port Adelaide.

title.children: Collingwood star Maynard escapes injury after 'unfortunate' car crash

image.altText: Four young girls wearing red headbands with white feathers stand in a line and smile.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners say the newly dedicated Central Western Desert IPA has been a long time coming and is another "little jigsaw" piece in their efforts to protect the landscape.

title.children: New Indigenous protected area spanning 4m hectares 'a jewel' for all

image.altText: a crab eating a small starfish

props.synopsis: Researchers have found crabs are key predators of juvenile crown-of-thorns starfish and could be a hidden link to what controls their destructive spread.

title.children: Crabs could be key to tackling the 'secret army' of starfish destroying the reef

image.altText: A man armed with a rifle wearing camouflage gear standing alongside a green and yellow passenger train carriage

props.synopsis: Pakistan authorities say the day-long stand off involving hundreds of hostages has ended.

title.children: Pakistan's army says 21 hostages dead after train siege ends

image.altText: A man standing in front of a truck wearing a black top.

props.synopsis: A new report on Islamophobia in Australia has found a steep increase in assaults, abuse and threats.

title.children: Cars set alight, people hit, abuse on social media. Islamophobia is on the rise

image.altText: Sam Konstas in a blue hat

props.synopsis: Sam Konstas's state coach believes the headline-grabbing teenager is starting to show signs of heeding lessons around match situations in his batting.

title.children: Konstas 'still working the game out' after eye-catching shots and low scores

image.altText: Five member of The Cruel Sea pose by a yellow pick-up track and panel shed.

props.synopsis: The Australian icons still sound as relevant as ever in 2025. Plus, four more recent album recommendations.

title.children: The Cruel Sea are back with their first album since 2001

image.altText: An older trans woman sits on set in front of a pink background next to a young trans man

props.synopsis: From transgender rights to gender euphoria, 71-year-old trans liberation pioneer Dr Jess Hooley and 23-year-old musician and trans man Flynn Sant (aka flowerkid) compare being trans in the past and present.

title.children: Trans people have always been here — two generations talk about what's changed
